content.raw:
Hey Martin,

Your `solution docker` image should only contain your controller\(s\) code.  Not the bridge, not the sim, not the testbed, just your team’s code.  See the [Dockerfile](#!/osrf/subt_seed/src/default/docker/subt_solution/Dockerfile) in the [subt\_seed repo](#!/osrf/subt_seed/src/default/) as a reference.

@{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} will check your AWS run and post comments back here \(if applicable\).  However, for solution executed in the Cloudsim, it is probably better you send a private message by clicking on the Help button in the Web Portal. That way nothing sensitive in your algorithms is disclosed.
content.html:
Hey Martin,

Your solution docker image should only contain your controller(s) code. Not the bridge, not the sim, not the testbed, just your team’s code. See the Dockerfile in the subt_seed repo as a reference.

@Nate Koenig will check your AWS run and post comments back here (if applicable). However, for solution executed in the Cloudsim, it is probably better you send a private message by clicking on the Help button in the Web Portal. That way nothing sensitive in your algorithms is disclosed.
